Health Care Workers.name: EvergreenHealth Medical Center
Health Care Workers.description: Founded in 1972, EvergreenHealth has served nearly 850,000 residents in the north King and south Snohomish counties. During the initial outbreak of the coronavirus, Evergreen became one of the first hospitals to respond to the epicenter of cases clustered in the Kirkland region.

Health Care Workers.name: Harborview Medical Center
Health Care Workers.description: Harborview Medical Center is a comprehensive healthcare facility dedicated to providing specialized care for a broad spectrum of patients from throughout the Pacific Northwest, including the most vulnerable residents of King County.

Health Care Workers.name: Seattle Children's Hospital
Health Care Workers.description: The Seattle Children's Hospital specializes in the care of infants, children, teens, and young adults aged 0-21 in several specialties.

Health Care Workers.name: Virginia Mason Hospital and Seattle Medical Center
Health Care Workers.description: Virginia Mason operates an acute care hospital in Seattle, licensed for 336 beds, which includes one of the region's busiest emergency departments.

Health Care Workers.name: Overlake Medical Center & Clinics
Health Care Workers.description: Overlake Medical Center is a 349-bed, nonprofit regional medical center offering a full range of advanced medical services to the Puget Sound region. Led by a volunteer board of trustees, we employ nearly 3,000 people and have some 1,000 active and courtesy providers on our medical staff, including more than 200 providers who are employed by the organization.

Nursing Home Workers.name: Sunrise Senior Living: Bellevue
Nursing Home Workers.description: Located in downtown Bellevue behind Crossroads Shopping Center, Sunrise of Bellevue is senior living home in Washington. At the facility, registered nurses are on site 16 hours a day to support the health and safety of the seniors at the facility.

Nursing Home Workers.name: Island House Assisted Living
Nursing Home Workers.description: Located near I-90 in the heart of Town Center, Island House Assisted Living is a senior living community in Mercer Island, WA.

Nursing Home Workers.name: Sunrise Senior Living: Mercer Island
Nursing Home Workers.description: Located on beautiful Mercer Island in Lake Washington, Sunrise of Mercer Island is senior living home in Washington. At the facility, registered nurses and designated care managers are on site 16 hours a day to support the health and safety of the seniors at the facility.

Homeless Shelter Workers.name: Mary's Place Seattle
Homeless Shelter Workers.description: Located in the heart of Downtown Seattle, Mary's Place helps women and families to move out of homelessness into a more stable life, providing meals, showers, and laundry facilities. The workers at Mary's Place Seattle are working hard to open new facilities while to handle the new influx of homeless caused by the economic downfall of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Homeless Shelter Workers.name: Noel Women's House
Homeless Shelter Workers.description: Noel House Programs provides shelter, food, and services for over 250 women experiencing homelessness. The workers at Noel are working hard to provide homeless women affected by the pandemic nutritious meals and a safe place to sleep.

Homeless Shelter Workers.name: Aloha Inn
Homeless Shelter Workers.description: The Aloha Inn is a resident managed transitional housing program for over 60 homeless adults and couples without children. Amidst the pandemic, Aloha Inn has provided essential services such as housing counseling, vision, and dental care, and personal counseling to those affected by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Homeless Shelter Workers.name: Sacred Heart
Homeless Shelter Workers.description: Sacred Heart Shelter provides safe, comfortable shelter to families experiencing the crisis of homelessness. Caring for families with minor children (18 years or younger), Sacred Heart Shelter has been a crucial aid to the homeless Seattle community affected by COVID-19.
